instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 20V 0.500A No usb activity
threads.message:
Clean board no history.
[LIST]
[*]No USB activity can be detected
[*]Charger takes 0.5 A at 20 V (goes up from 5 V).
[*]PP3V3_G3H =3.4 V
[*]ppsv3_s4=3.32V
[*]ppsv3_s5=3.32V
[*]pp5v = 5.1 V
[*]PPVCCCPU_S0G stays at 0.94 V
[/LIST]
Already tried clean working BIOS same thing, CPU gets hot

threads.title: 820-00840 20V 0.500A No usb activity
threads.message:
As explained in other thread, CPU core should drop to 0.6V, when the board boots.
Did you test the board alone on the desk (no SSD even)?
Any history available?

threads.title: 820-00840 20V 0.500A No usb activity
threads.message: No history available, I will keep the drop information in mind for future references. All my work is always done on board alone nothing else connected at all unless needed for testing the board, so no SSD and nothing else connected and those numbers are the ones I get.

threads.title: 820-00840 20V 0.500A No usb activity
threads.message:
Quoting Dukefawks, "these boards (00840/75) are garbage".

If no luck to find some corroded/broken resistor, or other component, then probably bad CPU...

threads.title: 820-00840 20V 0.500A No usb activity
threads.message: Ok so if  CPU core does not drop to 0.6V dont even bother with BIOS?

threads.title: 820-00840 20V 0.500A No usb activity
threads.message: You've said already tried good BIOS...
